abstract: Brian Moynihan said the financial industry needed to embrace a looming regulatory overhaul instead of fight it, but added that breaking up the biggest United States banks would be a mistake.
snippet: Brian Moynihan said the financial industry needed to embrace a looming regulatory overhaul instead of fight it, but added that breaking up the biggest United States banks would be a mistake.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of Bank of America, Brian Moynihan, said the financial industry needed to embrace a looming regulatory overhaul instead of fight it, but added that breaking up the biggest United States banks would be a mistake.

headline.main: BofA Chief Disagrees With Calls for Bank Breakups
